arm_group.description: Treatment with Picato according to Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC)

brief_summary.textblock:
Assessment of treatment success and quality of life in patients with actinic keratoses under
      therapy with Ingenol Mebutate (Picato) in a period of 8 weeks.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Treatment Success and Quality of Life in Patients With Actinic Keratoses Under Therapy With Ingenol Mebutate in a Period of 8 Weeks

detailed_description.textblock: Non-interventional (observational) study (NIS), non-controlled, prospective cohort study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        • Non-hyperkeratotic, non-hypertrophic actinic keratoses where treatment with Picato® is
        indicated and the treatment is intended by physicians.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Preceding use of Picato® on the area planned for treatment

          -  Any other specific local treatment of actinic keratoses on the area planned for
             treatment during the last 8 weeks

          -  Melanoma, squamous cell carcinoma or spinalioma on the area planned for treatment

          -  Open wounds on the area planned for treatment

          -  Contraindications according to prescribing information

study_pop.textblock: patients with actinic keratosis contacting their dermatologist

intervention.description: No intervention: observation of routine use of Picato®

clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Treatment Success and Quality of Life in Patients With Actinic Keratoses Under Therapy With Ingenol Mebutate (Picato) in a Period of 8 Weeks.

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices

primary_outcome.description: Documentation of the course of actinic keratoses and skin findings during ambulant routine use of Picato®
Patient' s quality of life during ambulant routine use of Picato®
Prescribed and applied dosages and adherence during ambulant routine use of Picato®

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
